title: Host-Pathogen Relationship Data Schema
description: Schema for extracted host-pathogen relationships from scientific literature for One Health PROTECT

reasoning.description: Your reasoning process: analyze document structure, identify data sources, assess extraction challenges, and explain decisions before extracting records

Detection_Method.description: Array of detection methods used for this host-pathogen relationship

items.description: Individual detection method (e.g., PCR, Serology, Culture, etc.)

Sample_type.description: Array of sample types that were tested (e.g., blood, tissue, tick midgut)

all_supporting_source_sentences.description: Array where each element contains exactly ONE sentence from the source document that supports this host-pathogen relationship

items.description: Individual supporting sentence from the document

Detection_Result_Direction.description: Whether the pathogen was detected in the host (positive), not detected (negative), or results were unclear (inconclusive)

Confidence_Score.description: Model confidence in extraction accuracy: 1 = very low confidence, 2 = low confidence, 3 = moderate confidence, 4 = high confidence, 5 = very high confidence

Vector_Name.description: Array of vector names from PDF (e.g., tick species)

GenBank_Accession.description: Array of GenBank Accession numbers reported in PDF

Extraction_quality_score.description: Source data quality in document: 1 = very poor quality (ambiguous, unclear), 2 = poor quality, 3 = moderate quality, 4 = good quality, 5 = very good quality (clear, explicit, well-documented)

Language_Not_English.description: Flag if language is not English - could affect extraction quality and should be reviewed by a human

Supplemental_Material.description: Does it seem like more information might be present in the supplemental data?

Observation_Type.description: Array of unique observation types present in this host-pathogen record (not tied to individual sentences, as one sentence may contain multiple types): primary = authors' own observations/data from this study, cited_observation = any citation or reference to other work, personal_communication = heard about but no citable evidence, unpublished_data = described as unpublished

items.description: An observation type present in this record

Cited_Observations.description: Array of citation references found in the supporting sentences for this host-pathogen interaction. Include citations as they appear in the document (e.g., 'Smith et al., 2020', '[15]', or other inline citation formats). Only include citations that provide evidence for this specific interaction.

items.description: Individual citation reference from the document
